left_text: Mandible of worker with four or ﬁve teeth along distal margin (Fig. 119-5c); inner surface of hind basitarsus of males and workers with basal sericeous area (Fig. 12010a)
right_text: Mandible of worker with lower half or two-thirds of distal margin edentate, upper part of margin with one or usually two teeth; inner surface of hind basitarsus of males without basal sericeous area, that of workers, variable

left_text: Metasoma short, about as wide as thorax, dorsoventrally ﬂattened; upper margin of hind tibia of worker usually with few plumose hairs, most of them with only two to six scattered branches not concentrated toward apices; yellow markings absent; vein M of forewing dark almost to wing margin
right_text: Metasoma usually narrower than thorax, often noticeably elongate; upper margin of hind tibia of worker with numerous strongly plumose hairs (Fig. 120-11a), usually with abundant branches toward apices; yellowish or reddish markings present on face of some species; vein M of forewing usually fading away near widest part of wing

left_text: Inner surface of hind basitarsus of worker with basal sericeous area covered with minute setae or sometimes lacking setae (Fig. 120-10a)
right_text: Inner surface of hind basitarsus of worker without basal sericeous area, rather uniformly setose

left_text: Posterior margin of vertex elevated as strong, hairy ridge between summits of eyes; upper distal angle of hind tibia of worker acute (Brazil)
right_text: Posterior margin of vertex not elevated; upper distal angle of hind tibia of worker broadly rounded

left_text: Labial palpi with large, sinuous setae on ﬁrst two segments (Fig. 120-12e)
right_text: Labial palpi with setae no longer than palpal width and straight or nearly so (Fig. 120-12c)
